definition: Dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucian (idiom)/sole dominant ideology
pinyin: ba4 chu4 bai3 jia1 , du2 zun1 ru2 shu4

definition: (final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to dismiss from office/to expel
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
alone/independent/single/sole/only
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
scholar/Confucian
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea
method/technique
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
to burn the Confucian classics and bury alive the Confucian scholars (acts supposedly committed by the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2])
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
Confucianism

unification (of the nation)/large scale unification
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
Shang Yang's political reform of Qin state 秦國|秦国 of 356 BC and 350 BC, that put it on the road to world domination
